\documentclass[english]{article}
\usepackage[T1]{fontenc}
\usepackage[latin1]{inputenc}
\usepackage{babel}

\makeatletter


%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%% LyX specific LaTeX commands.
\providecommand{\LyX}{L\kern-.1667em\lower.25em\hbox{Y}\kern-.125emX\@}

\makeatother

\begin{document}


\title{The Project Architect - Engineering tools}


\date{Date}


\author{Pascal Munerot}

\maketitle
\begin{abstract}
This document is a list of the tools that the project developers currently use
\end{abstract}

\section{Editors}

\begin{itemize}
\item Emacs
\item Nedit
\item Lyx : For good quality typesetting
\end{itemize}

\section{Libraries}

\begin{itemize}
\item wxWindows : A library designed for easy portability, together with a large set
of classes for about everything
\item libxml++ : xml, with C++ API.
\end{itemize}

\section{Programming languages}

\begin{itemize}
\item C/C++ : Core programming language
\item Perl : Plugins and code generation
\item XML : Data structures\end{itemize}

\end{document}
